meanings.definition: Lexica: the vocabulary of a language or subject
meanings.sent1: In her lexica, she keeps a list of all the new words she learns.
meanings.sent2: The lexica of the English language is vast and diverse.
meanings.sent3: The lexica of the cat included 'meow' and 'purr' as its favorite words.
meanings.sent4: His lexica of emotions was complex, ranging from joy to sorrow.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the lexica of science opened up a whole new world of knowledge.

meanings.definition: Lexica: a collection of words or phrases in a particular language
meanings.sent1: The lexica of the book included words from different languages.
meanings.sent2: She studied the lexica of Spanish to improve her vocabulary.
meanings.sent3: The lexica of the menu at the restaurant featured exotic dishes.
meanings.sent4: His lexica of jokes always brought laughter to the room.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the lexica of music introduced her to new genres and artists.

meanings.definition: Lexica: a reference book containing an alphabetical list of words with information about them
meanings.sent1: The student used the lexica to look up definitions of unfamiliar words.
meanings.sent2: The lexica on the shelf provided valuable information for the research paper.
meanings.sent3: The lexica on birds had colorful illustrations and interesting facts.
meanings.sent4: Her lexica of plants helped her identify different species in the garden.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the lexica of history revealed fascinating stories from the past.
